div.l: Oure hors is loste / Aleyne For goddes banes "Mon [heart symbol] est vostre du tout" written vertically in left margin, apparently after trimming; not the main scribe.
Steppe on̄ thi feete / come of man al at anes
Ellas oure wardeyne / haþe his palfrey lorn
Þis Aleyne al forgate boþe mele ⁊and corne
Al was oute of mynde his husbandrye
What whilke way is he goon / he gan to crye
Þe wyff come lepyng owtwardes at a rynne
Sho saide lo yondir he gooþᵉ in to þᵉ fenne
Wᵗith wyld maris / als faste as he may goo
Vnthanke come on̄ his hande þat bond him soo
And he that better should a knytte the Reyne
Ellas quod Iohan to Aleyne for crystes peyne
Laye downe thy swerde / and I wolle myn̄ alswa
I is als wyght god wat as is a Ra
Be goddys hert he shalle not scape vs baþᵉ
Whye naddest thow putte þe caple in þᵉ laþe
Yl hayle Aleyne / by god þowe is a Fonne
Þees two clerkes haue ful faste eronne
To wardes þe fennes / boþe Aleyne ⁊and eke Iohan
And whanne þe Myln̉er sawe þᵗat þey were goon
He halff a boschell of theyre floure hathe take
And bad his wyf goo knede hit in a cake
He saide I trowe þᵉ clerkis were a ferde
Yette can a myln̉er make booþe þeyr͗e berde
For al hir arte lete hem goo thir weye
Loo wher they Rynne / yee lette þᵉ chylder pleye
They gete him not so lyghtly be my crowne
Þees wery clerkes chasen vp ⁊and downe
With · keepe kepe whoo standetowe Iostey warder̉ere
Ga wyghtly þow ⁊and I shall kepe him̄ here
But shortly til þat it was verreye nyght
Þey kouþᵉ not for al boþee hir myght
Þe caple cacche he ran a wey sofaste
Til In a diche they caute hym̄ at þᵉ laste
¶ Wery ⁊and wete · as beste is in þe Rayne
Comyþe Iohan þe clerke ⁊and wᵗith him comythe Alayne
Ellas quod Iohan þe day þᵗat I was borne
Nowe ar we drevyin̄ to heþing ⁊and to scorne
Oure corne is stolne men wolle vs fals calle
Booþe þe wardeyne ⁊and oure felawes alle
And namelye þe myln̉er for shame wellawaye
Þus pleyneþe Iohan as he gooþe by þe waye

Aleyne leggeth
a nyghtÞe mylner by þe fuyre syttyng they fonde
Whan they cam ther wᵗith bayard in theyre hande
For hit was nyght ⁊and Fyrþ̉er myght they notte
But for þe love of god / þey him be sowght
Of harbarowe ⁊and of ease as for þeyre peny
Þe Mylner answerde hem yf þer be eny
Suche as it is yee shoule wele have yoᵘur yoᵘur parte
Myn̄ howse is streyte / but yee have lernid arte
Þat cōnne by argument make a large place
A myle brode in twenty Fete of space
¶ Lete see nowe yf þis place may suffice
Or makeþᵉ hit rowme wᵗith speche as is yowre guyse
Nowe symond said this Iohan by saint cutberd
Ay is thowetowethowe mury and þat is fayre answerd
I have herde seye þᵗat men should of two thyngꝭes
Take suche as he fynt or suche as he bryngꝭes
But speciallye I pray þee hooste dere
Gete vs sum mete or drynke ⁊and make vs chiere
For we wolle pay trewlye here at þᵉ fulle
Wᵗith empty hand men may noon haukes tulle
Loo here owre silủer redy for to spende

l.note: + We prey yᵉ hertly to þᵉ ton send"+" used to place the omitted line.

div.l: For ale ⁊and bred and Rosted hem a goos
And teyed thayre hors he shoulde nomore goo louse
¶ And in his owne chambre · made hem a bedde
Wᵗith sheetꝭes · and wᵗith chalouns feyre espredde
Nowte from his bedde but ten foote or twelve
His dowter hadde a bedde al by her͗e selve
Right in þᵉ same chaumbre by and by
Hit myght bee no bette and cause loo whye
Þer was no no Rommer harbarowe in þᵗat place
¶ Þey souped ⁊and speken hem to solace
And dronk ay a monge stronge ale at þᵉ beste
Abowtes mydnyght wenten þey to Reste
Welle hathe þis milner vernyshid his pillid hede
Ful pale he was for dronke ⁊and not Rede
He youghxseþe / and spekithe þorowe þᵉ noose
As he were on̄ þᵉ qwacke or on̄ the poose
¶ To bedde he gooþe / and wᵗith him gooþᵉ his wyf
As any Iaye she lyght was ⁊and Iolyff
So was her Ioly whistel wel I wette
Þe cradell at his beddis fete was sette
To rocken and eke to gyve þe chylde sowke
And whan þat dronkendonkendronken was al in þᵉ crowke
To bedde gooþe Alayne to bedde Eke gooþᵉ Iohan
To bedde went þe dowter þanne a noon
¶ Þer nas namore / For hem neodethe no dwale
Þis mylner haþe / so wyselye bibbed ale
Þat as an horsse / he sowreþe in his slepe
Ne of tayleonde he toke þer noo kepe
His wyf bare hym þer wᵗith a bourdowne stronge
Men myght weele here hem rowte a large fourlonge
Þe wenche rowted eke fast / ꝑpar coumpanye
¶ Aleyne þe clerke þᵗat herd þis melodye
He powked Iohan and sayde what slepes þowe
Herdestowe eủer slyke a song or nowe
Loo slyke a coupellyng / is by twene hem alle
A wyld fuyre / motte on̄ hir bodyes be falle
Who hard eủer suche a ferly thyng
Ye they shulle have þe flowr͗e of evil endyng
Þis long nyght / þer tydde me here na reste
But yette na force al shalle be for þᵉ beste
For Iohan saide þanne als haue I reste to nyght
